page.title: 20WASH LANE
page.content: Our area contains the valley of the River Rattlesden,locally called the River Rat,which is used as a Parish boundary. The map shows osier beds beside the river.These are willow trees which were cut for making baskets.This no longer happens. The average depth of the river is three feet.The ford on Wash Lane is usually quite shallow but after much rain it is unsuitable for vehicles.It is thought that originally the name of the lane was because of women coming to the river to wash clothes. At both ends of Wash Lane there are a few cottages.Some of the cottages were built in the late 1800's.
